trans-unit.source: Operations on Triggers
trans-unit.target: Operations on Triggers

trans-unit.source: Operations on Triggers
trans-unit.target: Operations on Triggers

trans-unit.source: Triggers are pieces of application logic that can executed before (pre-triggers) and after (post-triggers) creation, deletion, and replacement of a document.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are pieces of application logic that can executed before (pre-triggers) and after (post-triggers) creation, deletion, and replacement of a document.

trans-unit.source: Triggers are written in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are written in JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: Both pre and post triggers do no take parameters.
trans-unit.target: Both pre and post triggers do no take parameters.

trans-unit.source: Like stored procedures, triggers live within the confines of a collection, thus confining the application logic to the collection.
trans-unit.target: Like stored procedures, triggers live within the confines of a collection, thus confining the application logic to the collection.

trans-unit.source: The trigger resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>triggers</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The trigger resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>triggers</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: There is a quota limit on the number of triggers created in a collection.
trans-unit.target: There is a quota limit on the number of triggers created in a collection.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Similar to stored procedures, the triggers resource has a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: Similar to stored procedures, the triggers resource has a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: The body property contains the application logic.
trans-unit.target: The body property contains the application logic.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a trigger.
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a trigger.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name used to identify the trigger.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name used to identify the trigger.

trans-unit.source: The id must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The id must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: body
trans-unit.target: body

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: This is the body of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: This is the body of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: triggerOperation
trans-unit.target: triggerOperation

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is the type of operation that will invoke the trigger.
trans-unit.target: This is the type of operation that will invoke the trigger.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>Insert</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>Replace</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Delete</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>Insert</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>Replace</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Delete</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: triggerType
trans-unit.target: triggerType

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This specifies when the trigger will be fired.
trans-unit.target: This specifies when the trigger will be fired.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are: <parameterReference>Pre</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Post</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are: <parameterReference>Pre</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Post</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Pre</parameterReference> triggers fire before an operation while <parameterReference>Post</parameterReference> triggers after an operation.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Pre</parameterReference> triggers fire before an operation while <parameterReference>Post</parameterReference> triggers after an operation.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the trigger resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the trigger resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the uniquely addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the uniquely addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: The following are the allowable operations on triggers.
trans-unit.target: The following are the allowable operations on triggers.

trans-unit.source: Create a trigger
trans-unit.target: Create a trigger

trans-unit.source: Replace a trigger
trans-unit.target: Replace a trigger

trans-unit.source: List triggers
trans-unit.target: List triggers

trans-unit.source: Delete a trigger
trans-unit.target: Delete a trigger

trans-unit.source: Query triggers
trans-unit.target: Query triggers

trans-unit.source: The REST operations for triggers are similar to the ones for documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: The REST operations for triggers are similar to the ones for documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>docs</legacyItalic></legacyBold>, they are performed against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>triggers</legacyItalic></legacyBold> resource path under a particular collection.
trans-unit.target: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>docs</legacyItalic></legacyBold>, they are performed against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>triggers</legacyItalic></legacyBold> resource path under a particular collection.

trans-unit.source: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.
trans-unit.target: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.

trans-unit.source: For information on how UDFs work including invoking a trigger, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>..
trans-unit.target: For information on how UDFs work including invoking a trigger, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>..
